t: Luke 16
The Unrighteous Steward
Now*p He was also saying to the disciples, “There*r was*r a*r rich*r man*r who*r had*r a*r manager,*r and*r this*r manager*ir was*r reported*r to*r him*r as*r squandering*r his*r possessions.*r
And*r he*r called*r him*r and*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘What*r is*r this*r I*r hear*r about*r you?*r Give*r an*r accounting*r of*r your*r management,*r for*r you*r can*r no*r longer*r be*r manager.’*r

The*r manager*r said*r to*r himself,*r ‘What*r shall*r I*r do,*r since*r my*r master*r is*r taking*r the*r management*r away*r from*r me?*r I*r am*r not*r strong*r enough*r to*r dig;*r I*r am*r ashamed*r to*r beg.*r
I*r know*r what*r I*r shall*r do,*r so*r that*r when*r I*r am*r removed*r from*r the*r management*r people*r will*r welcome*r me*r into*r their*r homes.’*r
And*r he*r summoned*r each*r one*r of*r his*r master’s*r debtors,*r and*r he*r began*ir saying*r to*r the*r first,*r ‘How*r much*r do*r you*r owe*r my*r master?’*r
And*r he*r said,*r ‘A*r hundred*r measures*r of*r oil.’*r And*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Take*r your*r bill,*r and*r sit*r down*r quickly*r and*r write*r fifty.’*r

Then*r he*r said*r to*r another,*r ‘And*r how*r much*r do*r you*r owe?’*r And*r he*r said,*r ‘A*r hundred*r measures*r of*r wheat.’*r He*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘Take*r your*r bill,*r and*r write*r eighty.’*r

And*r his*r master*r praised*r the*r unrighteous*r manager*r because*r he*r had*r acted*r shrewdly;*r for*r the*r sons*r of*r this*r age*r are*r more*r shrewd*r in*r relation*r to*r their*r own*r kind*r than*r the*r sons*r of*r light.*r

And*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r make*r friends*r for*r yourselves*r by*r means*r of*r the*r wealth*r of*r unrighteousness,*r so*r that*r when*r it*r fails,*r they*r will*r receive*r you*r into*r the*r eternal*r dwellings.*r

“He*rp who*r is*r faithful*r in*r a*r very*r little*r thing*r is*r faithful*r also*r in*r much;*r and*r he*r who*r is*r unrighteous*r in*r a*r very*r little*r thing*r is*r unrighteous*r also*r in*r much.*r
Therefore*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r faithful*r in*r the*r use*ir of*ir unrighteous*r wealth,*r who*r will*r entrust*r the*r true*r riches*ir to*r you?*r
And*r if*r you*r have*r not*r been*r faithful*r in*r the*ir use*ir of*ir that*r which*r is*r another’s,*r who*r will*r give*r you*r that*r which*r is*r your*r own?*r

No*r servant*r can*r serve*r two*r masters;*r for*r either*r he*r will*r hate*r the*r one*r and*r love*r the*r other,*r or*r else*r he*r will*r be*r devoted*r to*r one*r and*r despise*r the*r other.*r You*r cannot*r serve*r God*r and*r wealth.”*r
Now*p the Pharisees, who were lovers of money, were listening to all these things and were scoffing at Him.

And He said to them, “You*r are*r those*r who*r justify*r yourselves*r in*r the*r sight*r of*r men,*r but*r God*r knows*r your*r hearts;*r for*r that*r which*r is*r highly*r esteemed*r among*r men*r is*r detestable*r in*r the*r sight*r of*r God.*r

“The*rp Law*r and*r the*r Prophets*r were*ir proclaimed*ir until*r John;*r since*r that*r time*r the*r gospel*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r been*r preached,*r and*r everyone*r is*r forcing*r his*r way*r into*r it.*r
But*r it*r is*r easier*r for*r heaven*r and*r earth*r to*r pass*r away*r than*r for*r one*r stroke*r of*r a*r letter*r of*r the*r Law*r to*r fail.*r
“Everyone*rp who*r divorces*r his*r wife*r and*r marries*r another*r commits*r adultery,*r and*r he*r who*r marries*r one*r who*r is*r divorced*r from*r a*r husband*r commits*r adultery.*r
The Rich Man and Lazarus
“Now*rp there*r was*r a*r rich*r man,*r and*r he*r habitually*r dressed*r in*r purple*r and*r fine*r linen,*r joyously*r living*r in*r splendor*r every*r day.*r
And*r a*r poor*r man*r named*r Lazarus*r was*r laid*r at*r his*r gate,*r covered*r with*r sores,*r
and*r longing*r to*r be*r fed*r with*r the*r crumbs*ir which*r were*r falling*r from*r the*r rich*r man’s*r table;*r besides,*r even*r the*r dogs*r were*r coming*r and*r licking*r his*r sores.*r
Now*r the*r poor*r man*r died*r and*r was*r carried*r away*r by*r the*r angels*r to*r Abraham’s*r bosom;*r and*r the*r rich*r man*r also*r died*r and*r was*r buried.*r
In*r Hades*r he*r lifted*r up*r his*r eyes,*r being*r in*r torment,*r and*r saw*r Abraham*r far*r away*r and*r Lazarus*r in*r his*r bosom.*r

And*r he*r cried*r out*r and*r said,*r ‘Father*r Abraham,*r have*r mercy*r on*r me,*r and*r send*r Lazarus*r so*r that*r he*r may*r dip*r the*r tip*r of*r his*r finger*r in*r water*r and*r cool*r off*r my*r tongue,*r for*r I*r am*r in*r agony*r in*r this*r flame.’*r

But*r Abraham*r said,*r ‘Child,*r remember*r that*r during*r your*r life*r you*r received*r your*r good*r things,*r and*r likewise*r Lazarus*r bad*r things;*r but*r now*r he*r is*r being*r comforted*r here,*r and*r you*r are*r in*r agony.*r

And*r besides*r all*r this,*r between*r us*r and*r you*r there*r is*r a*r great*r chasm*r fixed,*r so*r that*r those*r who*r wish*r to*r come*r over*r from*r here*r to*r you*r will*r not*r be*r able,*r and*r that*ir none*r may*r cross*r over*r from*r there*r to*r us.’*r
And*r he*r said,*r ‘Then*r I*r beg*r you,*r father,*r that*r you*r send*r him*r to*r my*r father’s*r house—*r
for*r I*r have*r five*r brothers—in*r order*r that*r he*r may*r warn*r them,*r so*r that*r they*r will*r not*r also*r come*r to*r this*r place*r of*r torment.’*r
But*r Abraham*r said,*r ‘They*r have*r Moses*r and*r the*r Prophets;*r let*r them*r hear*r them.’*r
But*r he*r said,*r ‘No,*r father*r Abraham,*r but*r if*r someone*r goes*r to*r them*r from*r the*r dead,*r they*r will*r repent!’*r
But*r he*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘If*r they*r do*r not*r listen*r to*r Moses*r and*r the*r Prophets,*r they*r will*r not*r be*r persuaded*r even*r if*r someone*r rises*r from*r the*r dead.’ ”*r
